definition: to sweep the streets/to canvas (for votes, sales etc)

sentences.english: She's a bank manager and I'm just a road-sweeper.
sentences.chinese: 她是银行经理，而我不过是个扫街的。

sentences.english: However, the colonial British government channelled them into the trade of sweepers.
sentences.chinese: 但是，英国殖民政府给他们安排了扫街的工作。

sentences.english: We are not respected by anyone because we are sweepers.
sentences.chinese: 没有人尊重我们，因为，我们是扫街的。

sentences.english: We are street cleaners, so we wear orange clothes.
sentences.chinese: 我们是扫街的人，所以我们穿橘色的衣服。

sentences.english: An army of salespeople canvassed the country to promote the new product.
sentences.chinese: 一大群推销员在全国扫街以推广新产品。

definition: variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
camera (abbr. for 照相機|照相机[zhao4 xiang4 ji1])/at the opportune moment/as the circumstances allow
film/roll of film/also written 膠捲|胶卷
see 單反相機|单反相机[dan1 fan3 xiang4 ji1]
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
to document on film the course of events/to follow sb with a camera
